lexUnit.name: loathe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel hatred or disgust for.

sentence.text: I loathe men who trifle with women 's affections .
You come to fear and loathe reserved passengers who turn up after the flight is supposed to have left , squeezing out standbys .
` How I loathe people who raise one's hopes , only to dash them to the ground ! "
` I 'll ask no leading questions , as I remember how I loathed them when I first started seeing a lot of Tom .
I have not loved to be very bold afore women , much more would I loathe to come into the hands of any living man , be he physician or surgeon . "
Mercedes-Benz 's proud engineers also loathe being lumped in with companies making everything from washing machines to weapons .
` I loathe being called Mademoiselle . "
Much as I loathe using the term ` chops " , you possess them in abundance .
God , I loathe Alejandro for allowing it .
And I loathed all sport to the point of finding its ethics repellent .
It seemed odd that he loathed her with such intensity and yet had made a pass at her .
You may feel so attached to your baby that you loathe the thought of leaving him .
I just loathe the thought of telling my nasty little tale a second time . "
` I absolutely loathe grey gloves , as you well know by now !
He loathed the sterile ritual of inspections , and this poor devil in his untimely end had saved him from that .
The electorate may loathe the Tories , but it has yet to learn to love Labour .
But whether they love you or loathe you , never expect to get your property back .
He is loathed by some , more traditionally minded officers for his astute and ready use of publicity .

Adolf Hitler 's ruthless occupation policy across Europe and the discovery of the concentration camps ensured that Germans were loathed and hated and the destruction they suffered was seen as deserved .
Within journalism , MacKenzie is either loved or loathed .
Churchill hates Stalin , Stalin loathes Churchill and that sick old man Roosevelt understands and trusts neither .
Her tone said that she still loathed the Harlequin man , yet she felt compelled to be accurate .
She loathed her mother 's loathing of Mrs Hanney ; it made her shiver with horror .
I adore crumpets ; and I loathe romanticism and that ` all for love and the world well lost " stuff .
He loathed the constant uproar of our house and only wanted peace and quiet when he was in the house .
With every fibre of his being , he loathed the woman he had married .
" I loathe you because you 're still jealous of her .
She is then obliged , under the terms of his will , to deal with his lawyer , Charlie Leveque , whom she has never met but loathes on principle .
It was a job I loathed .
She , Topaz , would love Andrew whilst she still drew breath , but he was imprisoned at High Brook with a wife he loathed .
` I loathe and detest you , Luke Travis , " Merrill whispered later , as she hung up the pink dress .
